p:
One hundred milligrams of each fresh leaf sample from the four treatment was ground with a sterile pestle and morter. The samples were transferred into 15‐ml tubes followed by the addition of 10 ml 96% ethanol. After mixing well, the tubes were placed at 4°C for two days. The samples were centrifuged at 17925 g at 4°C for 1 min, and then, the OD value of the supernatant was determined at wavelengths of 470, 665, and 649 nm with an MAPADA UV‐1200 spectrophotometer (Shanghai Meipuda Instrument Co. Ltd.). The contents of chlorophyll a, b, and total carotenoid for all samples were calculated according to previous studies as follows: C a = 13.95 × A665–6.88 × A645; C b = 24.96 × A649–7.32 × A665; C x
+c = (1,000A470–2.05 C a–114.8 C b)/245 (Lichtenthaler & Wellburn, 1985).
